Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Amulets
Description: Four amulets depicting the lion-headed goddess Sekhmet, one of which is seen in profile, whose head is surmounted by a headdress featuring the solar disc. The right arm hangs along the body whereas the left is bent at the waist. The other surface is flat. The amulets were part of the design of a necklace and were held vertically inbetween two rows of beads by a double thread that was threaded through holes near the feet and at the top of the head, just below the headdress.
